framework.name: Positive Info-Entropic Geometric Unification
framework.domain: Positive geometry integrating info-entropic holography with pseudospectral extensions and fluid dynamics unification
framework.description: This theory synthesizes emergent gravity from statistical manifolds with pseudospectral entropic geometry, incorporating 2025 advances in positive geometry for unification, fluid models of space-time, and lab tests for quantum gravity. It resolves vector instabilities via shape-defined stability and unifies forces across scales.

established_foundations.coverage: Scattering amplitudes unifying particle physics and cosmology
established_foundations.justification: Connects to string theory and holography (web:0, web:1, arXiv:2509.25372)

established_foundations.coverage: QNMs stability in AdS black holes
Relativity, QM, cosmology via compressible fluid
established_foundations.justification: Space-time as fluid with megastable quantization (web:20, web:21, PhysRevE.111.L022201)

research_focus.primary_hypothesis: Physics emerges from positive geometric structures on info-entropic manifolds, with space-time as a compressible fluid resolving quantum-classical transitions
research_focus.mathematical_basis: Amplituhedron canonical forms and pseudospectral operators deriving actions and stability

key_extensions.target_phenomenon: Resolve DM instabilities via shape constraints

key_extensions.theoretical_status: Classical system with infinite quantum levels (web:21)

key_extensions.testability: Atom interferometry, SYK model on quantum computers (web:42, web:43)

explicit_boundaries: Grounding 0.82 (vector resolutions speculative, lab tests emerging)

framework_metadata.processing_notes: Integrated 2025 advances: positive geometry (web:0-9), fluid unification (web:20-29), lab QG (web:40-49), pseudospectra (web:50-59); vector stability partial (web:30-39).

implementation_skeleton.description: Python for pseudospectrum in holographic QNMs (adapted).
implementation_skeleton.code:
import numpy as np
from scipy.linalg import norm

def pseudospectrum(A, epsilon=1e-3, grid_points=100):
    z_real = np.linspace(-1, 1, grid_points)
    z_imag = np.linspace(-1, 1, grid_points)
    Z_real, Z_imag = np.meshgrid(z_real, z_imag)
    sigma = np.zeros_like(Z_real)
    for i in range(grid_points):
        for j in range(grid_points):
            z = Z_real[i,j] + 1j * Z_imag[i,j]
            resolvent = np.linalg.inv(z * np.eye(A.shape[0]) - A)
            sigma[i,j] = norm(resolvent) > 1 / epsilon
    return sigma  # Binary map for stability in QNMs
